blocks.name: pjth
blocks.content: Projection Theorem: Any Hilbert space vector ` A ` can be decomposed uniquely into a member ` x ` of a closed subspace ` H ` and a member ` y ` of the complement of the subspace. Theorem 3.7(i) of [Beran] p. 102 (existence part). (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm pjth(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wceq(co(c1, c4, cfv(c5, c1)), c6))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clsm, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cocv, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clss, c0))
} = {
  eqelssd(hs0, co(c1, c4, cfv(c5, c1)), c6, w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wss(co(c1, c4, cfv(c5, c1)), c6), wcel(co(c1, c4, cfv(c5, c1)), c2))
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wcel(co(c1, c4, cfv(c5, c1)), c2), wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cfv(c5, c1), c2))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cphl))
  phllmod(c0)
  simp2(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wcel(cfv(c5, c1), c2), wcel(c0, cphl), wss(c1, c6))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)), wcel(c0, cphl))
  hlphl(c0)
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)), wss(c1, c6))
  lssss(c1, c2, c6, c0)
  ocvlss(c0, c1, c6, c5, c2)
  lsmcl(c0, c1, c2, cfv(c5, c1), c4)
  lssss(co(c1, c4, cfv(c5, c1)), c2, c6, c0)
  pjthlem2(cv(hs0), c1, c4, c5, c6, c0, cfv(cnm, c0), cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(csg, c0), cfv(cip, c0), c2, c3, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wcel(cv(hs0), c6)))
  eqid(cfv(cnm, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(csg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cip, c0))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), c6))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), c6))
  simpr(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wcel(cv(hs0), c6))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), c6))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c1, c4, cfv(c5, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c6)
  diff.hs0.w(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))))
}

thm pjth(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3))→(c1[c4](c5 ` c1))= c6)
  ⊣ c6 =(Base ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(LSSum ` c0)
  ⊣ c5 =(ocv ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(TopOpen ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(LSubSp ` c0)
} = {
  eqelssd(hs0, (c1[c4](c5 ` c1)), c6, (c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)))
  syl((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)), (c1[c4](c5 ` c1))⊆ c6, (c1[c4](c5 ` c1))∈ c2)
  syl3anc((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)), (c1[c4](c5 ` c1))∈ c2, c0 ∈ LMod, c1 ∈ c2, (c5 ` c1)∈ c2)
  syl((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)), c0 ∈ LMod, c0 ∈ PreHil)
  phllmod(c0)
  simp2(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3))
  syl2anc((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)), (c5 ` c1)∈ c2, c0 ∈ PreHil, c1 ⊆ c6)
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3), c0 ∈ PreHil)
  hlphl(c0)
  3ad2ant2(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3), c1 ⊆ c6)
  lssss(c1, c2, c6, c0)
  ocvlss(c0, c1, c6, c5, c2)
  lsmcl(c0, c1, c2, (c5 ` c1), c4)
  lssss((c1[c4](c5 ` c1)), c2, c6, c0)
  pjthlem2(hs0, c1, c4, c5, c6, c0, (norm ` c0), (+ ` c0), (-g ` c0), (· ` c0), c2, c3, ((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3))∧ hs0 ∈ c6))
  eqid((norm ` c0))
  eqid((+ ` c0))
  eqid((-g ` c0))
  eqid((· ` c0))
  simpl1(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3), hs0 ∈ c6)
  simpl2(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3), hs0 ∈ c6)
  simpr((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)), hs0 ∈ c6)
  simpl3(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3), hs0 ∈ c6)
  diff.hs0.c((c1[c4](c5 ` c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c6)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)))
}

blocks.name: pjth2
blocks.content: Projection Theorem with abbreviations: A topologically closed subspace is a projection subspace. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm pjth2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wcel(c1, cdm(c4)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clss, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cpj, c0))
} = {
  mpbir2and(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wcel(c1, cdm(c4)), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(co(c1, cfv(clsm, c0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c0), c1)), cfv(cbs, c0)))
  simp2(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)))
  pjth(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(clsm, c0), cfv(cocv, c0), cfv(cbs, c0))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3))), wb(wcel(c1, cdm(c4)), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(co(c1, cfv(clsm, c0), cfv(cfv(cocv, c0), c1)), cfv(cbs, c0)))), wcel(c0, cphl))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c3)), wcel(c0, cphl))
  hlphl(c0)
  pjdm2(c0, c1, c4, c2, cfv(clsm, c0), cfv(cocv, c0), cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cocv, c0))
  eqid(cfv(clsm, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm pjth2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3))→ c1 ∈ dom(c4))
  ⊣ c3 =(TopOpen ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(LSubSp ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(proj ` c0)
} = {
  mpbir2and((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)), c1 ∈ dom(c4), c1 ∈ c2, (c1[(LSSum ` c0)]((ocv ` c0)` c1))=(Base ` c0))
  simp2(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3))
  pjth(c0, c1, c2, c3, (LSSum ` c0), (ocv ` c0), (Base ` c0))
  syl((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3)), (c1 ∈ dom(c4)↔(c1 ∈ c2 ∧(c1[(LSSum ` c0)]((ocv ` c0)` c1))=(Base ` c0))), c0 ∈ PreHil)
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c3), c0 ∈ PreHil)

blocks.name: cldcss
blocks.content: Corollary of the Projection Theorem: A topologically closed subspace is algebraically closed in Hilbert space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cldcss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, chl), wb(wcel(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4)))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ctopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(clss, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ccss, c0))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, chl), wb(wcel(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4))))), wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  impbida(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wa(wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4))))
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4)))
  sylan(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c0, cphl))
  csslss(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  sylan(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4)), wcel(c0, ccph))
  hlcph(c0)
  csscld(c0, c1, c2, c4)
  3expb(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4)), wcel(c1, c2))
  sseldd(c1, c2, cdm(cfv(cpj, c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4))))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4))), wss(cdm(cfv(cpj, c0)), c2), wcel(c0, cphl))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c1, c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ccld, c4)), wcel(c0, cphl))
  hlphl(c0)
  pjcss(c0, cfv(cpj, c0), c2)
  pjth2(c0, c1, c3, c4, cfv(cpj, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cpj, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cldcss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ CHil →(c1 ∈ c2 ↔(c1 ∈ c3 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4))))
  ⊣ c5 =(Base ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(TopOpen ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(LSubSp ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(ClSubSp ` c0)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 ∈ CHil →(c1 ∈ c2 ↔(c1 ∈ c3 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4)))), c5 =(Base ` c0))
  impbida(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, (c1 ∈ c3 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4)))
  jca((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c2), c1 ∈ c3, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4))
  sylan(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈ c3, c0 ∈ PreHil)
  csslss(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  sylan(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c2, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4), c0 ∈ CPreHil)
  hlcph(c0)
  csscld(c0, c1, c2, c4)
  3expb(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c3, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4), c1 ∈ c2)
  sseldd(c1, c2, dom((proj ` c0)), (c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c3 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4)))
  syl((c0 ∈ CHil ∧ c1 ∈ c3 ∧ c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4)), dom((proj ` c0))⊆ c2, c0 ∈ PreHil)
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ CHil, c1 ∈ c3, c1 ∈(Clsd ` c4), c0 ∈ PreHil)
  hlphl(c0)
  pjcss(c0, (proj ` c0), c2)
  pjth2(c0, c1, c3, c4, (proj ` c0))
  eqid((proj ` c0))
}

blocks.name: cldcss2
blocks.content: Corollary of the Projection Theorem: A topologically closed subspace is algebraically closed in Hilbert space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Oct-2015.)

thm cldcss2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, chl), wceq(c1, cin(c2, cfv(ccld, c3))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clss, c0))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ccss, c0))
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, c1, cin(c2, cfv(ccld, c3)), wcel(c0, chl))
  syl6bbr(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(c2, cfv(ccld, c3))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ccld, c3))))
  cldcss(c0, cv(hs0), c1, c2, c3, c4)
  elin(cv(hs0), c2, cfv(ccld, c3))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cin(c2, cfv(ccld, c3)))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, chl))

  syl6bbr(c0 ∈ CHil, hs0 ∈ c1, hs0 ∈(c2 ⋂(Clsd ` c3)), (hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c3)))
  cldcss(c0, hs0, c1, c2, c3, c4)

  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ CHil)

blocks.name: hlhil
blocks.content: Corollary of the Projection Theorem: A subcomplex Hilbert space is a Hilbert space (in the algebraic sense, meaning that all algebraically closed subspaces have a projection decomposition). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm hlhil(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c0, chil))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wcel(c0, chl), wcel(c0, chil), wcel(c0, cphl), wceq(cdm(cfv(cpj, c0)), cfv(ccss, c0)))
  eqssd(cdm(cfv(cpj, c0)), cfv(ccss, c0), wcel(c0, chl))
  syl(wcel(c0, chl), wss(cdm(cfv(cpj, c0)), cfv(ccss, c0)), wcel(c0, cphl))
  hlphl(c0)
  pjcss(c0, cfv(cpj, c0), cfv(ccss, c0))
  eqsstrd(cfv(ccss, c0), cdm(cfv(cpj, c0)), cin(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(ccld, cfv(ctopn, c0))), wcel(c0, chl))
  cldcss2(c0, cfv(ccss, c0), cfv(clss, c0), cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  ssrdv(hs0, cin(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(ccld, cfv(ctopn, c0))), cdm(cfv(cpj, c0)), wcel(c0, chl))
